H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H1747.def: = state in which someone refrains from speaking

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H6362.def: = state in which humans have been released from a certain task or duty

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1556.def: = causative action by which humans cause an object to move by turning it over and over

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6499.def: = young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H47.def: = male bovine; ≈ symbol of deities and associated with power and strength, but also with aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H3803.def: = process by which humans refrain from action for some time

H7580.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1749.def: = solid, yellowish substance ◄ secreted by bees; ► used in different ways; ≈ melts before fire and so becomes a metaphor for disappearance, destruction, and death

H4549.def: = process by which substances become soft, ◄ often as a result of  a higher temperature

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H2789.def: = container ◄ made of baked clay; ► used for household activities, in sacrificial rituals, and for the storage of documents; ≈ regarded as of low value

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H3611.def: = relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a {L:pig<SDBH:חֲזִיר>}; associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H5712.def: = a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H5362.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife, razor, or axe to remove part of a larger object

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

2.gl: to dry up > to become weak

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H360.def: = state of being strong, powerful, and able to save others

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3173.def: = state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3611.def: = relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a {L:pig<SDBH:חֲזִיר>}; associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H7214.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a wild, untamable animal with horns, and very strong; perhaps wild ox, buffalo, or rhinoceros; ≈ symbol of strength, wildness, and power

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H8262.def: = causative action by which humans make themselves unclean by engaging with unclean things

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4940.def: = a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H4410.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

14.gl: ends of the earth > all people on earth

H1879.def: = state in which plants and their products are full of the juices and condiments that cause them to be of a good quality and in a healthy condition

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
